RALPH_VALIDATION.feedback: Solid implementation: all 18 packages compile, 969 test runs pass with race detection, cross-compilation works for all 3 platforms. However, T078 wiring is incomplete: main.go does not create or assign CrossRunner or TasksValRunner on the orchestrator. The model.SetupCrossValidation(), model.SetupFinalPlanValidation(), and model.SetupTasksValidation() functions are implemented but never called. This means cross-validation (US5) and tasks validation (US5) will never execute in the real binary. Fix: In cmd/ralph-loop/main.go runOrchestrator(), after creating impl/val runners, call model.SetupCrossValidation() and model.SetupTasksValidation(), then create and assign orch.CrossRunner and orch.TasksValRunner using the resolved AI/model values. Also, T125 (golangci-lint) and T132 (goreleaser check) were not actually run — the implementer admitted these tools are not installed. Consider installing them or documenting the gap. T126-T128 parity checks lack recorded evidence.
incomplete_tasks: T078 (incomplete wiring - CrossRunner and TasksValRunner not created in main.go)
